description: These no-knead rolls get their color and flavor from grated sweet potato and present beautifully on the potluck table.
headline: No-Knead Sweet Potato Rolls Are the Easiest Way to Win Any Fall Potluck

HowtoTip.text: Storage: The rolls are best served the day they are made, but can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days.

name: No-Knead Sweet Potato Rolls Are the Easiest Way to Win Any Fall Potluck
recipeIngredient: 4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for shaping
1/2 teaspoon coarse or flaky salt, such as Maldon

recipeInstructions.text: Peel 1/2 small sweet potato and grate on the large holes of a box grater until you have 1 1/4 cups. Strip the leaves from 1 rosemary sprig and finely chop (about 2 teaspoons). Place both in a large bowl. Add 4 cups flour and 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt and toss to coat the sweet potato in the flour.

Melt 6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) of the unsalted butter; set aside to cool. Combine 3/4 cup whole milk and 3/4 cup water in a 2-cup or larger microwave-safe cup and microwave until lukewarm, about 100oF but no hotter, 30 to 40 seconds. Add 1 egg, 1 packet instant yeast (2 1/4 teaspoons), and 2 tablespoons honey, and whisk with a fork until combined.

Add the butter and milk mixture to the sweet potato mixture, and stir until a shaggy dough forms and no more dry flour is visible. The dough will be very sticky. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, 1 1/4 to 1/2 hours.

Coat a 2-quart baking dish (such as an 11x7-inch) or a 9-inch round cake pan with cooking spray. Sprinkle a work surface with a generous dusting of flour and place the dough on it. Dust more flour on top and press the dough into a thick disk. Use a bench scraper or knife to divide the dough into 12 pieces. Shape the pieces into balls and place them in the baking dish or cake pan (they will be touching). Lightly cover with plastic wrap and let rise at warm room temperature until doubled in size, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 350oF.

Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons unsalted butter. Uncover the rolls and brush with half of the butter. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon coarse or flaky salt. Bake until golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes. Place the pan on a wire rack, brush with the remaining butter, and let cool completely.
